Distributed LDA

Topic modeling with parallel computing

Source: vignettes/pkgdown/distributed.Rmd
distributed.Rmd

Distributed LDA can dramatically speeds up your analysis by using multiple processors on your computer. The number of topic is small in this example, but the distributed algorithm is highly effective in identifying many topics (k > 100) in a large corpus.

Preperation

We prepare the Sputnik corpus on Ukraine in the same way as in the introduction.

library(seededlda)
library(quanteda)

corp <- readRDS("data_corpus_sputnik2022.rds")
toks <- tokens(corp, remove_punct = TRUE, remove_symbols = TRUE, 
               remove_numbers = TRUE, remove_url = TRUE)
dfmt <- dfm(toks) |> 
    dfm_remove(stopwords("en")) |>
    dfm_remove("*@*") |>
    dfm_trim(max_docfreq = 0.1, docfreq_type = "prop")
print(dfmt)
#> Document-feature matrix of: 8,063 documents, 58,541 features (99.77% sparse) and 4 docvars.
#>              features
#> docs          reiterated commitment diplomacy worsened reporters urge best
#>   s1092644731          1          1         8        1         2    1    1
#>   s1092643478          0          0         0        0         0    0    0
#>   s1092643372          0          0         0        0         0    0    0
#>   s1092643164          0          0         0        0         0    0    0
#>   s1092641413          0          0         6        0         0    0    0
#>   s1092640142          0          0         0        0         0    0    0
#>              features
#> docs          forward continuing buildup
#>   s1092644731       1          2       2
#>   s1092643478       0          0       0
#>   s1092643372       1          0       0
#>   s1092643164       0          0       0
#>   s1092641413       0          1       0
#>   s1092640142       0          0       0
#> [ reached max_ndoc ... 8,057 more documents, reached max_nfeat ... 58,531 more features ]

Distributed LDA

When batch_size = 0.01, the distributed algorithm allocates 1% of the documents in the corpus to each processor. It uses all the processors by default, but you can limit the number through options(seededlda_threads).

lda_dist <- textmodel_lda(dfmt, k = 10, batch_size = 0.01, verbose = TRUE)
#> Fitting LDA with 10 topics
#>  ...initializing
#>  ...using up to 16 threads for distributed computing
#>  ......allocating 81 documents to each thread
#>  ...Gibbs sampling in 2000 iterations
#>  ......iteration 100 elapsed time: 10.41 seconds (delta: 0.44%)
#>  ......iteration 200 elapsed time: 18.69 seconds (delta: 0.12%)
#>  ......iteration 300 elapsed time: 26.50 seconds (delta: 0.01%)
#>  ......iteration 400 elapsed time: 34.16 seconds (delta: 0.01%)
#>  ......iteration 500 elapsed time: 41.79 seconds (delta: -0.01%)
#>  ......iteration 600 elapsed time: 49.81 seconds (delta: -0.00%)
#>  ......iteration 700 elapsed time: 57.38 seconds (delta: 0.04%)
#>  ......iteration 800 elapsed time: 64.92 seconds (delta: 0.04%)
#>  ......iteration 900 elapsed time: 72.42 seconds (delta: -0.01%)
#>  ......iteration 1000 elapsed time: 80.09 seconds (delta: -0.03%)
#>  ......iteration 1100 elapsed time: 87.81 seconds (delta: 0.03%)
#>  ......iteration 1200 elapsed time: 95.49 seconds (delta: 0.05%)
#>  ......iteration 1300 elapsed time: 103.13 seconds (delta: 0.02%)
#>  ......iteration 1400 elapsed time: 110.56 seconds (delta: 0.02%)
#>  ......iteration 1500 elapsed time: 118.18 seconds (delta: -0.09%)
#>  ......iteration 1600 elapsed time: 125.84 seconds (delta: 0.02%)
#>  ......iteration 1700 elapsed time: 133.47 seconds (delta: 0.00%)
#>  ......iteration 1800 elapsed time: 140.89 seconds (delta: 0.00%)
#>  ......iteration 1900 elapsed time: 148.49 seconds (delta: -0.05%)
#>  ......iteration 2000 elapsed time: 156.05 seconds (delta: 0.00%)
#>  ...computing theta and phi
#>  ...complete

Despite the much shorter execution time, it identifies topic terms very similar to the standard LDA.

knitr::kable(terms(lda_dist))
topic1 topic2 topic3 topic4 topic5 topic6 topic7 topic8 topic9 topic10
trump photo joins taiwan dpr british india grain per lavrov
hunter azov joined chinese lpr johnson indian finland nord alliance
congress mediabank journalist beijing civilians french cooperation air companies negotiations
democrats killed hour say shelling truss africa systems stream zelensky
twitter battalion talk interests plant german iran sea fuel proposals
republicans police author soviet zaporozhye macron african missiles pipeline peskov
republican video analyst know biological boris south sweden crude agreements
bill refugees spoke believe civilian chancellor trade turkey imports diplomatic
senate children mark never kherson france summit missile natural ambassador
bidenâ€™s human sean strategic strikes scholz saudi black cap spokesman

Distributed LDA with convergence detection

The algorithm fits LDA through 2000 iterations by default to produce reliable results, but we can can minimize the number using the convergence detection mechanism to further speed up your analysis. When auto_iter = TRUE, the algorithm stop inference on convergence (delta < 0) and return the results.

lda_auto <- textmodel_lda(dfmt, k = 10, batch_size = 0.01, auto_iter = TRUE,
                          verbose = TRUE)
#> Fitting LDA with 10 topics
#>  ...initializing
#>  ...using up to 16 threads for distributed computing
#>  ......allocating 81 documents to each thread
#>  ...Gibbs sampling in up to 2000 iterations
#>  ......iteration 100 elapsed time: 10.33 seconds (delta: 0.52%)
#>  ......iteration 200 elapsed time: 19.41 seconds (delta: 0.09%)
#>  ......iteration 300 elapsed time: 28.51 seconds (delta: 0.03%)
#>  ......iteration 400 elapsed time: 37.79 seconds (delta: 0.06%)
#>  ......iteration 500 elapsed time: 46.95 seconds (delta: 0.02%)
#>  ......iteration 600 elapsed time: 56.22 seconds (delta: 0.01%)
#>  ......iteration 700 elapsed time: 65.49 seconds (delta: 0.03%)
#>  ......iteration 800 elapsed time: 74.65 seconds (delta: -0.08%)
#>  ...computing theta and phi
#>  ...complete
knitr::kable(terms(lda_auto))
topic1 topic2 topic3 topic4 topic5 topic6 topic7 topic8 topic9 topic10
per dpr british trump systems taiwan joins photo alliance india
companies civilians german hunter air biological joined soviet grain indian
fuel lpr stream congress missile intelligence journalist know lavrov cooperation
crude shelling johnson democrats missiles research hour russians turkey africa
imports plant nord republicans equipment chinese talk refugees finland trade
production zaporozhye truss election training activities author ukrainians sweden iran
cap mediabank pipeline republican aircraft agency analyst say negotiations african
natural azov boris bidenâ€™s army space spoke never agreement south

exports video berlin senate vehicles service mark nazi peskov chinese
